items.title: VI Live: Sierhuis zet Fortuna weer naast AZ, Lamine Yamal verdubbelt voorsprong
items.summary: Naast de duels van PSV en Feyenoord die we in een apart liveblog volgen, staan er nog drie Eredivisie-duels op het programma. Daarnaast wordt er ook volop gevoetbald in het buitenland. In deze VI Live blijf je daarvan volledig op de hoogte.

items.title: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
items.summary: Chelsea hammer Liverpool 9-1 to reach the Women's League Cup semi-finals, while Manchester City, Manchester United and Arsenal also progress.

items.title: World Darts Championship: Cross wins after frustrated Cullen crashes out LIVE!
Van Persie ziet gelijkspel met Twente als gewonnen punt: 'Hoe raar dat ook klinkt'
items.summary: De winterstop is 'een welkome break', vertelde Robin van Persie na het duel met FC Twente. Het gelijkspel tegen Twente voelt als een gewonnen punt voor de trainer van Feyenoord. Dat zat hem vooral in het kwakkelende spel van de Rotterdammers in de eerste helft. Ook vertelde Van Persie over een uitgaande transfer, die aanstaande lijkt.

items.title: Go Ahead sluit bijzonder jaar af: 'Mogen trots zijn op deze kleine club'
items.summary: Melvin Boel kijkt tevreden terug op de eerste seizoenshelft van Go Ahead Eagles. De Deventenaren liepen zondag tegen FC Groningen op de laatste benen na het drukke schema met Europese wedstrijden en pakten een punt. Boel is trots op zijn ploeg, maar ziet ook verbeterpunten.

items.title: Borges keek goal af van 'goede vriend' Quaresma: 'Hij is een soort broer'
items.summary: Feyenoord speelde zondagmiddag een hele moeizame wedstrijd tegen FC Twente, maar Gon√ßalo Borges gold als √©√©n van de weinige lichtpuntjes in De Kuip. Met een weergaloze goal redde de Portugees een punt voor de Rotterdammers. Dat had hij van een goede, beroemde vriend.

items.title: Aston Villa v Manchester United: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 4.30pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Table | Follow us on Bluesky | Email Tim We have a minor celebrity in the tunnel! Kelly Osbourne, daughter of the late lamented Ozzy, is there and she‚Äôs wearing a Villa shirt. Is she playing? No, her son Sid is a mascot today. He‚Äôs not holding hands with John McGinn in the traditional fashion ‚Äì he‚Äôs in his arms. That United XI doesn‚Äôt look very hard to beat. Patrick Dorgu, a regular earlier this year, went down the pecking order because of being ‚Äúanxious‚Äù with his final ball, as Amorim put it. Manuel Ugarte has been trusted with a start only three times this season ‚Äì in the 3-0 defeat at Man City, the 3-1 defeat at Brentford, and the 2-2 embarrassment at Grimsby. (Plus one game for Uruguay ‚Äì the 5-1 thrashing by the USA.) Continue reading...

items.title: Cullen says Suljovic's behaviour is 'not darts' after defeat in feisty encounter
items.summary: Joe Cullen has responded with fury after being dumped out of the World Darts Championship by Mensur Suljovic, saying the Austrian's behaviour on stage is "not darts".

items.title: FC Twente baalt na: 'We hebben Feyenoord helemaal aan gort gespeeld'
items.summary: Bij FC Twente overheerst de teleurstelling na het gelijkspel in De Kuip tegen Feyenoord . Daan Rots vond zelfs dat de Tukkers de Rotterdammers helemaal aan gort hebben gespeeld.

items.title: Isak injured while scoring in Liverpool win at Spurs
items.summary: Liverpool forward Alexander Isak could be facing a lengthy spell on the sidelines after suffering an injury in his team's Premier League clash with Tottenham Hotspur.

items.title: USA's Pepi scores again in PSV comeback win
items.summary: United States forward Ricardo Pepi continued his excellent run of form with a goal that helped PSV Eindhoven beat Utrecht 2-1 on Sunday.

items.title: Mbapp√© equals Ronaldo record, hits 'Siu' celeb
items.summary: Kylian Mbapp√© added his name to another line in the record books on Saturday, tying Cristiano Ronaldo for the most goals by a Real Madrid player in a calendar year.

items.title: Barcelona's Christensen sidelined with ACL injury
items.summary: Andreas Christensen faces a long spell on the sidelines after suffering an ACL injury.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal unfazed by Man City title charge
items.summary: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal were not distracted by Manchester City moving top of the Premier League before the Gunners reclaimed number one spot hours later with a 1-0 win at Everton.

items.title: Liverpool fear significant lower leg injury for Isak
items.summary: Liverpool fear Alexander Isak has sustained a significant lower leg injury after the striker was forced off against Tottenham on Saturday.

items.title: Hearts tighten grip on Premiership top spot as Shankland strikes to down Rangers
items.summary: Rangers arrived in Edinburgh with a view to reminding onlookers they can be a key component in this season‚Äôs Scottish title race. They departed as the latest victims of the Hearts juggernaut. Back to back wins against Celtic had already been secured before Hearts repeated the trick against Rangers. Dreams of a first Hearts title since 1960 are not merely alive. They are growing. Rangers are a dozen points adrift of Derek McInnes‚Äôs team after this, a first away league defeat of 2025. Hearts are 18 games and halfway towards the promised land. Rangers had arguably been the better side before Hearts whacked them with two, decisive first-half goals. Stuart Findlay claimed the first of them, the centre back rising highest after Alexandros Kyziridis combined with Claudio Braga for a short corner. Kyziridis‚Äôs cross was pinpoint. The Greek winger had earlier threatened the Rangers goal twice, the visitors having a potential opener ruled out for an offside against Bojan Miovski. Continue reading...

items.title: Chelsea hammer dismal Liverpool 9-1 and storm into Women‚Äôs League Cup semis
items.summary: Quarter-final: Liverpool 1-9 Chelsea Rytting Kaneryd scores hat-trick as Blues run riot It is not supposed to be this easy, in a quarter-final between two top-flight sides. Chelsea barely broke sweat as they put nine goals past woeful Liverpool, including a hat-trick from Johanna Rytting Kaneryd and two goals from an in-form Sam Kerr. It took just 13 minutes for Chelsea to take the lead. Niamh Charles‚Äôs low ball into the box found Kerr, who darted in front of her marker with ease and found the near, bottom corner. Continue reading...

items.title: Lightning strikes twice! Schaper wins again via play-off eagle in Mauritius
items.summary: Jayden Schaper secured his second DP World Tour title in as many weeks after a hole-out eagle at the second play-off hole saw him win the AfrAsia Bank Mauritius Open.

items.title: Taylor sorry for 'blatant lying' after failed drugs test
items.summary: Dom Taylor has apologised for "blatant lying" after he was thrown out of the World Darts Championship for failing a drugs test at the tournament.

items.title: NZ openers make Test history with centuries each in both innings
items.summary: Tom Latham and Devon Conway earned a unique place in Test history when their 192-run second innings partnership paved the way for New Zealand's declaration at 306-2 on the fourth day of the third Test against West Indies.
